meanings.definition: The tough outer layer of certain fruits or cheeses.
meanings.sent1: I love to eat the crunchy rinds of apples.
meanings.sent2: The orange rinds add a burst of flavor to the dish.
meanings.sent3: The playful squirrel nibbled on the discarded rinds of the watermelon.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like the crackling of dried rinds.
meanings.sent5: The rinds of the cheese were so sharp, they reminded me of tiny knives.

meanings.definition: To remove the outer layer of something.
meanings.sent1: She carefully rinds the skin off the potatoes before cooking them.
meanings.sent2: The chef rinds the lemon zest to use in the recipe.
meanings.sent3: He rinds the old paint off the walls to prepare for a fresh coat.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor rinds away the excess clay to reveal the masterpiece within.
meanings.sent5: The gardener rinds the bark from the tree to inspect for pests.
